h1: How Many Calories in a New York Steak?
assumptions: 8 oz (227 g) boneless New York strip steak, grilled, lean and fat included, choice grade, no added oils or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut size, grade, cooking method, fat trimming, and added ingredients. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One 8 oz New York steak provides ~547 kcal and ~56 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Pan-seared with 1 tsp oil per steak

faqs.q: How many calories in a New York steak?
faqs.a: About 547 kcal for an 8 oz grilled New York strip steak.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a New York steak?
faqs.a: Roughly 56 g protein per 8 oz serving.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in New York steak?
faqs.a: Yes—grilling keeps it lower; frying or butter-basting adds 40–100 kcal.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a New York steak?
faqs.a: About 35 g total fat, including 14 g saturated, for an 8 oz steak.

faqs.q: Are New York steaks high in cholesterol?
faqs.a: Yes, around 186 mg per 8 oz due to natural beef content.
